com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util

Class DtoComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.DtoComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>

    public class DtoComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>
    A special Comparator for Dtos and other Comparable objects

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DtoComparator CaseSensitive
      Other Comparator instance for case sensitive String comparison
      static DtoComparator IgnoreCase
      Default Comparator instance intended for sorting, that ignores case when comparing Strings

      protected int compareDates(java.util.Date date1, java.util.Date date2)
      Caution: Some databases do not store milliseconds, so comparing a Date retrieved from a Database with the same date in Java can differ by the milliseconds.
      protected int compareLists(java.util.List<?> list1, java.util.List<?> list2, boolean sort)
      Compare two list, optionally sorting them before comparing

      • DtoComparator

        public DtoComparator()
        Create a default DtoComparator, that ignores case when comparing Strings

      • DtoComparator

        public DtoComparator(boolean ignoreCase)
        Create a new DtoComparator
        Parameters:
        ignoreCase - whether String comparison should be case sensitive (false) or insensitive (true)

    • Method Detail

      • isIgnoringCase

        public boolean isIgnoringCase()
        Check if this DtoComparator ignores case when comparing Strings
        Returns:
        true if this DtoComparator ignores case when comparing Strings, false if String comparison is case sensitive

      • compare

        public int compare(java.lang.Object obj1,
          java.lang.Object obj2)
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>

      • compare

        public int compare(java.lang.Object obj1,
          java.lang.Object obj2,
          boolean sort)
        Compare two objects, optionally sorting lists before comparing
        Parameters:
        obj1 - first object to compare
        obj2 - second object to compare
        sort - true to sort lists prior to comparing, otherwise false
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.

      • sort

        public <T> java.util.List<T> sort(java.util.List<T> list,
                         boolean copy)
        Sort (a copy of) the specified list
        Parameters:
        list - to sort (may contain objects of different classes)
        copy - whether to sort and return a shallow copy of the original list (true), or the original list itself (false)
        Returns:
        the sorted (copy of the) list

      • sort

        public <T> java.util.List<T> sort(java.util.List<T> list)
        Sort the specified list
        Parameters:
        list - to sort (may contain objects of different classes)
        Returns:
        the sorted list

      • compareLists

        protected int compareLists(java.util.List<?> list1,
               java.util.List<?> list2,
               boolean sort)
        Compare two list, optionally sorting them before comparing
        Parameters:
        list1 - first list to compare
        list2 - second list to compare
        sort - true to sort lists prior to comparing, otherwise false
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first list is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.

      • compareDates

        protected int compareDates(java.util.Date date1,
               java.util.Date date2)
        Caution: Some databases do not store milliseconds, so comparing a Date retrieved from a Database with the same date in Java can differ by the milliseconds. So ignore milliseconds for comparison

      • compareStrings

        protected int compareStrings(java.lang.String str1,
                 java.lang.String str2)
        Compare two strings, treat blank strings equal
        Parameters:
        str1 - to compare
        str2 - to compare
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first string is less than, equal to, or greater than the second string.
